channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Telegraph pole loose wire, 15th September
item.description:
A cable has become disconnected from this telegraph pole in the wind and is hanging loose, blowing around and hitting pedestrians

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Rise, Perry Vale, London

item.title: Issue tree, 15th September
item.description:
This afternoon I came home and, once again, I found large branches from this tree, which I believe has been dead for quite some time, in the garden near the entrance. Moreover, as time goes by, this huge tree is gradually damaging the supporting wall. In my opinion, in the future, with strong winds, it could become a serious problem. Could you please take action? Thanks Sergio

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping bucket of white paint, 15th September
item.description:
A cracked and leaking bucket of white paint was found dumped near the recycling bins. It appears that the bucket may have been brought into Sydenham Hill Estates from Lordship Lane prior to 14:30. The paint has spread and is now all over the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lapse Wood Walk, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses and bade, 15th September
item.description:
Someone living in the flats outside 92 leather bottle green has dumped mattresses and base up against the side wall of my house. I rang Peabody on 12/09/25 as everyone else just walks passed it is all still there soaking wet making the area look run down, there are to many lazy people around.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes on pavement, 15th September
item.description:
These bikes have been on the pavement for months. They look terrible they smell of petrol the owner doesn’t even live where they are dumped. The council isn’t interested so I have bone through to you, The area looks so untidy people just don’t care I have lived on thamesmead 50 years and never seen things look so bad.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commerical waste left outside of timebands daily, 15th September
item.description:
Commercial waste is placed on the pavement adjacent to New Green Supermarket every day in the afternoon - not inside the time band specified for Green Lanes (8-9pm) It encourages other people to treat it like a bin and blocks the path for pedestrians
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potential fire hazard, 15th September
item.description:
Someone has been hoarding furniture and junk for the past month in a garden that is accessible to everyone. A fire only takes a second to start. Something needs to be done

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Milton Gardens Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 15th September
item.description:
There is a flytip behind 139 and 141 queen Anne avenue on the service road, this consists of several, wardrobe doors, and large wood and a plastic desk. It does not belong to the neighbours nearby those properties. Some has disposed the rubbish there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Durham Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
